content: Whereas the Bush enemies list consisted of terrorist nations, terrorist groups, and evil dictators, Obama's enemies list consists of hardworking American achievers. He wants to stop fighting terrorists and start fighting Americans who he believes cannot be successful without taking from other Americans. This isn't a zero-sum game... quote: "He hasn't called anyone an 'evildoer' or denounced an 'axis of evil.' But make no mistake: President Obama is putting together an enemies list," New York Daily News columnist Michael Goodwin writes. "Strangely, though, those on it are not terrorists or foreign dictators. They are mostly Americans lucky enough to have succeeded through capitalism and democracy," Mr. Goodwin said. "In the President's words, they are guilty of being 'special interests' and 'lobbyists.' The Bush-era tax cuts were merely 'an excuse to transfer wealth to the wealthy,' and he will bring fairness by raising taxes on "the wealthiest 2 percent of Americans.' "His barbs flow almost daily, faulting corporate leaders for 'greed' and shirking 'a sense of responsibility.' And sometimes he suggests the problem is criminal, as when he defended his plan for an expanded government push into health insurance as necessary 'to keep the private sector honest.' "Less than half-way through what should be a 100-day honeymoon, the Obama administration is on a war footing. Make that a class-war footing. "Sometimes the targets are critics, including two TV commentators singled out by press secretary Robert Gibbs for faulting the president's bailout plans. "Sometimes the targets are Republicans, like conservative talker Rush Limbaugh, the focus of a plan led by chief of staff Rahm Emanuel to divide the GOP and score points with the Democratic base. "But the tone of the president's own attacks on industry and his spending and tax policies are increasingly worrying Wall Street and much of the business world." More... "http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2009/mar/09/inside-politics/" "The World's Finest"
quote: "He hasn't called anyone an 'evildoer' or denounced an 'axis of evil.' But make no mistake: President Obama is putting together an enemies list," New York Daily News columnist Michael Goodwin writes. "Strangely, though, those on it are not terrorists or foreign dictators. They are mostly Americans lucky enough to have succeeded through capitalism and democracy," Mr. Goodwin said. "In the President's words, they are guilty of being 'special interests' and 'lobbyists.' The Bush-era tax cuts were merely 'an excuse to transfer wealth to the wealthy,' and he will bring fairness by raising taxes on "the wealthiest 2 percent of Americans.' "His barbs flow almost daily, faulting corporate leaders for 'greed' and shirking 'a sense of responsibility.' And sometimes he suggests the problem is criminal, as when he defended his plan for an expanded government push into health insurance as necessary 'to keep the private sector honest.' "Less than half-way through what should be a 100-day honeymoon, the Obama administration is on a war footing. Make that a class-war footing. "Sometimes the targets are critics, including two TV commentators singled out by press secretary Robert Gibbs for faulting the president's bailout plans. "Sometimes the targets are Republicans, like conservative talker Rush Limbaugh, the focus of a plan led by chief of staff Rahm Emanuel to divide the GOP and score points with the Democratic base. "But the tone of the president's own attacks on industry and his spending and tax policies are increasingly worrying Wall Street and much of the business world." More... "http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2009/mar/09/inside-politics/"
reply: Whereas the Bush enemies list consisted of terrorist nations, terrorist groups, and evil dictators, Obama's enemies list consists of hardworking American achievers. He wants to stop fighting terrorists and start fighting Americans who he believes cannot be successful without taking from other Americans. This isn't a zero-sum game...  "The World's Finest"
title: Enemies List

content: Class warfare is what Pres Obama is good at.
reply: Class warfare is what Pres Obama is good at.

content: The problem isn't the welfare recipient as much as it is people like you that have a welfare mentality, and whose so-call compassion is keeping able-bodied individuals in poverty and wards of the state. I voluntarily donate to my church and several charities that help the poor, which I feel we all have a responsibility to do. I just don't believe it is the responsibility of the government to confiscate my money and dole it out to liberal causes I do not support. "The World's Finest"

content: quote: Originally posted by NickBrand: quote: Originally posted by jack_flats: quote: Originally posted by ACR26: Class warfare is what Pres Obama is good at. It's about time a President stood up for the middle class and those less fortunate. That kind of rhetoric sounds awefully close to what Hugo Chavez said.... Socialist States of America??? The United States has been a Socialist State for many-many years, and you are more than likely a beneficiary of the many social programs the United States offers it's citizens. Just recently, for example, the largest Socialist initiative ever supported by and pushed thru by none other than Republican President George W. Bush (seemingly so many peoples hero here), bailing out the banks and financial institutions (with little or no oversight or accountability), probably as a final reward paid for by US taxpayers for all their support of him the past 8 years. Your President, a flaming Socialist! At least the new President Obama has in place, checks, balances, and highly placed overseer's to make sure the Stimulus money will be spent properly. I believe you may just have "Socialism" a bit confused with "Communism" anyway. Nothing wrong with Socialism at all. "I believe that banking institutions are more dangerous to our liberties than standing armies." - T. Jefferson

content: Whereas the Bush enemies list consisted of terrorist nations, terrorist groups, and evil dictators, Obama's enemies list consists of hardworking American achievers. He wants to stop fighting terrorists and start fighting Americans who he believes cannot be successful without taking from other Americans. This isn't a zero-sum game... quote: "He hasn't called anyone an 'evildoer' or denounced an 'axis of evil.' But make no mistake: President Obama is putting together an enemies list," New York Daily News columnist Michael Goodwin writes. "Strangely, though, those on it are not terrorists or foreign dictators. They are mostly Americans lucky enough to have succeeded through capitalism and democracy," Mr. Goodwin said. "In the President's words, they are guilty of being 'special interests' and 'lobbyists.' The Bush-era tax cuts were merely 'an excuse to transfer wealth to the wealthy,' and he will bring fairness by raising taxes on "the wealthiest 2 percent of Americans.' "His barbs flow almost daily, faulting corporate leaders for 'greed' and shirking 'a sense of responsibility.' And sometimes he suggests the problem is criminal, as when he defended his plan for an expanded government push into health insurance as necessary 'to keep the private sector honest.' "Less than half-way through what should be a 100-day honeymoon, the Obama administration is on a war footing. Make that a class-war footing. "Sometimes the targets are critics, including two TV commentators singled out by press secretary Robert Gibbs for faulting the president's bailout plans. "Sometimes the targets are Republicans, like conservative talker Rush Limbaugh, the focus of a plan led by chief of staff Rahm Emanuel to divide the GOP and score points with the Democratic base. "But the tone of the president's own attacks on industry and his spending and tax policies are increasingly worrying Wall Street and much of the business world." More... "http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2009/mar/09/inside-politics/" "The World's Finest"

But make no mistake: President Obama is putting together an enemies list," New York Daily News columnist Michael Goodwin writes. "Strangely, though, those on it are not terrorists or foreign dictators. They are mostly Americans lucky enough to have succeeded through capitalism and democracy," Mr. Goodwin said. "In the President's words, they are guilty of being 'special interests' and 'lobbyists.' The Bush-era tax cuts were merely 'an excuse to transfer wealth to the wealthy,' and he will bring fairness by raising taxes on "the wealthiest 2 percent of Americans.' "His barbs flow almost daily, faulting corporate leaders for 'greed' and shirking 'a sense of responsibility.' And sometimes he suggests the problem is criminal, as when he defended his plan for an expanded government push into health insurance as necessary 'to keep the private sector honest.' "Less than half-way through what should be a 100-day honeymoon, the Obama administration is on a war footing. Make that a class-war footing. "Sometimes the targets are critics, including two TV commentators singled out by press secretary Robert Gibbs for faulting the president's bailout plans. "Sometimes the targets are Republicans, like conservative talker Rush Limbaugh, the focus of a plan led by chief of staff Rahm Emanuel to divide the GOP and score points with the Democratic base. "But the tone of the president's own attacks on industry and his spending and tax policies are increasingly worrying Wall Street and much of the business world." More... "http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2009/mar/09/inside-politics/"
reply: Whereas the Bush enemies list consisted of terrorist nations, terrorist groups, and evil dictators, Obama's enemies list consists of hardworking American achievers. He wants to stop fighting terrorists and start fighting Americans who he believes cannot be successful without taking from other Americans. This isn't a zero-sum game...  "The World's Finest"

content: Whereas the Bush enemies list consisted of terrorist nations, terrorist groups, and evil dictators, Obama's enemies list consists of hardworking American achievers. He wants to stop fighting terrorists and start fighting Americans who he believes cannot be successful without taking from other Americans. This isn't a zero-sum game... quote: "He hasn't called anyone an 'evildoer' or denounced an 'axis of evil.' But make no mistake: President Obama is putting together an enemies list," New York Daily News columnist Michael Goodwin writes. "Strangely, though, those on it are not terrorists or foreign dictators. They are mostly Americans lucky enough to have succeeded through capitalism and democracy," Mr. Goodwin said. "In the President's words, they are guilty of being 'special interests' and 'lobbyists.' The Bush-era tax cuts were merely 'an excuse to transfer wealth to the wealthy,' and he will bring fairness by raising taxes on "the wealthiest 2 percent of Americans.' "His barbs flow almost daily, faulting corporate leaders for 'greed' and shirking 'a sense of responsibility.' And sometimes he suggests the problem is criminal, as when he defended his plan for an expanded government push into health insurance as necessary 'to keep the private sector honest.' "Less than half-way through what should be a 100-day honeymoon, the Obama administration is on a war footing. Make that a class-war footing. "Sometimes the targets are critics, including two TV commentators singled out by press secretary Robert Gibbs for faulting the president's bailout plans. "Sometimes the targets are Republicans, like conservative talker Rush Limbaugh, the focus of a plan led by chief of staff Rahm Emanuel to divide the GOP and score points with the Democratic base. "But the tone of the president's own attacks on industry and his spending and tax policies are increasingly worrying Wall Street and much of the business world." More... "http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2009/mar/09/inside-politics/" "The World's Finest"
quote: "He hasn't called anyone an 'evildoer' or denounced an 'axis of evil.' But make no mistake: President Obama is putting together an enemies list," New York Daily News columnist Michael Goodwin writes. "Strangely, though, those on it are not terrorists or foreign dictators. They are mostly Americans lucky enough to have succeeded through capitalism and democracy," Mr. Goodwin said. "In the President's words, they are guilty of being 'special interests' and 'lobbyists.' The Bush-era tax cuts were merely 'an excuse to transfer wealth to the wealthy,' and he will bring fairness by raising taxes on "the wealthiest 2 percent of Americans.' "His barbs flow almost daily, faulting corporate leaders for 'greed' and shirking 'a sense of responsibility.' And sometimes he suggests the problem is criminal, as when he defended his plan for an expanded government push into health insurance as necessary 'to keep the private sector honest.' "Less than half-way through what should be a 100-day honeymoon, the Obama administration is on a war footing. Make that a class-war footing. "Sometimes the targets are critics, including two TV commentators singled out by press secretary Robert Gibbs for faulting the president's bailout plans. "Sometimes the targets are Republicans, like conservative talker Rush Limbaugh, the focus of a plan led by chief of staff Rahm Emanuel to divide the GOP and score points with the Democratic base. "But the tone of the president's own attacks on industry and his spending and tax policies are increasingly worrying Wall Street and much of the business world." More... "http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2009/mar/09/inside-politics/"
reply: Whereas the Bush enemies list consisted of terrorist nations, terrorist groups, and evil dictators, Obama's enemies list consists of hardworking American achievers. He wants to stop fighting terrorists and start fighting Americans who he believes cannot be successful without taking from other Americans. This isn't a zero-sum game...  "The World's Finest"
title: Enemies List
